title: Design scheduling UI to support cross-border payment setup and FX rate previews
summary: Create an intuitive user interface enabling users to schedule cross-border payments with upfront FX rate previews. The UI must clearly present scheduling options and ensure transparency in rate selection for international transactions.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Enhance the payments UI to allow scheduling, FX rate previews, locking actions, expiry visuals

title: Implement FX rate lock option with selectable expiry window (e.g., 24h) after scheduling
summary: Provide a functionality allowing users to lock in a foreign exchange rate for a fixed, user-selected expiry window after scheduling a payment. This ensures price certainty and risk mitigation against FX fluctuations.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: users to lock foreign exchange (FX) rates for a defined window (e.g., 24 hours), ensuring price certainty

title: Display FX lock expiry details and countdown timers in the user interface
summary: Surface FX rate lock expiry information and real-time countdowns in the payment UI. This visually alerts users to the remaining validity window for their locked rate, increasing transparency and preventing confusion.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Enhance the payments UI to allow ... expiry visuals, and countdowns

title: Integrate with FX rate providers for real-time rate fetch and lock confirmation
summary: Connect and interface with external FX rate provider APIs to retrieve live exchange rates and process lock confirmations in real time. Ensure the system handles external data consistency and transaction reliability.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Integrate with external FX rate providers for real-time quotes and locking commitments

title: Revert to live FX rate and notify users if lock expires without funding
summary: If a user fails to fund a payment within the FX lock window, the system must revert to the latest available FX rate and promptly notify the user. This prevents stale rate execution and keeps the transaction process transparent.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Payment logic must handle rate expiry, user funding failures, and enable notification

title: Record all locked FX rates, metadata, and expiry data for audit and reconciliation
summary: Store all locked FX rates together with full metadata and expiry information to enable complete audit trails and finance reconciliation. The solution must ensure robust, tamper-evident record keeping aligned with audit requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: record all rate locks with audit metadata

title: Validate locked rate at execution; require user confirmation if rate expired
summary: Upon payment execution, the system must verify the validity of the locked FX rate. If the rate has expired, confirmation from the user is required before proceeding to avoid unintended rate acceptance.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Payment logic must handle rate expiry ... require user confirmation if rate expired

title: Support partial/full cancellation of scheduled payments with refunds and notifications
summary: Allow users or system administrators to cancel scheduled payments either partially or in full, ensuring that refunds are processed and users are notified. This feature increases flexibility and user trust in the scheduling system.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: enable pre-execution cancellations with appropriate refund, notification

title: Implement controls against abuse of FX rate locks (e.g., repeated locking/cancelling)
summary: Introduce mechanisms to detect and prevent abuse of the FX rate lock function, such as users repeatedly locking and cancelling to speculate on rates. Enforcement policies must be auditable and aligned with regulatory oversight.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Build mechanisms to prevent abuse of rate locks (e.g., speculative cancelling), support regulatory documentation

title: Support regulatory documentation for large-value cross-border payments
summary: Implement workflows to collect and manage regulatory documentation for high-value cross-border transfers, ensuring adherence to compliance requirements and enabling smooth audit processes.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: support regulatory documentation for large-value transfers, and maintain complete audit logs

title: Maintain audit logs for all scheduling, FX locking, and execution events
summary: Implement comprehensive audit logging to capture all user and system actions related to payment scheduling, FX rate locking, and payment executions. This ensures traceability for compliance and supports investigations or regulatory reporting.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Maintain complete audit logs.

title: Send confirmations, reminders, and expiry alerts via email, SMS, and in-app notifications
summary: Establish a multichannel notification system to inform users at key stages in scheduled payments, including confirmations, reminders before execution, and expiry alerts. This maximizes usability and reduces missed transactions.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Notify users at all key stages (confirmation, reminders, expiry) via multiple channels.

title: Develop dashboards for finance/compliance teams to monitor payments, locks, and exceptions
summary: Create monitoring dashboards for finance and compliance personnel to review scheduled payments, rate locks, and exception events. These dashboards support operational oversight and regulatory auditing.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Provide dashboards for finance/compliance monitoring.

title: Restrict new payment scheduling during FX provider outages and notify users of service limitations
summary: Implement logic to block scheduling of new payments when FX services are unavailable, and promptly notify users of any service limitations. This prevents failed lock actions and improves system transparency.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Support edge cases such as FX provider outages.

title: Handle insufficient balance at execution: auto-cancel or retry scheduled payment
summary: Define failure handling for scheduled payments that cannot execute due to insufficient user balance, enabling either automatic cancellation or a retry mechanism. This improves payment reliability and reduces manual intervention.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Handle rate expiry, user funding failures...

title: Integrate with FX provider APIs and validate contractual dependencies
summary: Build and verify integration with FX provider APIs, ensuring all contractual obligations are met before enabling live operations. This underpins real-time rate locks and compliance with third-party terms.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Integrate with external FX rate providers for real-time quotes and locking commitments.

title: Ensure no degradation to payment SLAs or regulatory deadlines with new features
summary: Guarantee that scheduled payment enhancements do not cause delays or missed cutoffs with respect to payment SLAs or regulation-mandated timelines. This is critical for ongoing trust and legal compliance.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Ensure payment processing SLAs/regulatory timelines remain unaffected.

title: Prepare and execute limited beta rollout with feedback collection processes
summary: Plan and launch a controlled beta release for the scheduled FX payments feature, incorporating mechanisms to capture user and support feedback to inform future improvements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: The feature will launch as a limited beta before general release, with user and support documentation and a structured feedback process.

title: Develop user and support documentation for new scheduled FX payment features
summary: Produce comprehensive documentation to support users and internal teams regarding the new scheduled FX payment capabilities. Clear guides enhance adoption and reduce support burden.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Develop user and support documentation for new scheduled FX payment features.

title: Deliver updated modules: UI, FX integration, audit/reporting tools per scope
summary: Deliver the comprehensive update covering user interface enhancements, FX provider integration, and audit/reporting functionality as specified in the overall project scope. Each module must meet quality and compliance requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Deliver updated modules: UI, FX integration, audit/reporting tools per scope.
